docs.lead_paragraph: SHORTLY after Lyndon Johnson became President, one of his closest unofficial advisers remarked that the country was about to learn something: "We're going to find out whether or not we have a Secretary of State."

headline.main: The Dean Rusk Show; The Dean Rusk Show(Cont.)

docs.snippet: SHORTLY after Lyndon Johnson became President, one of his closest unofficial advisers remarked that the country was about to learn something: "We're going to find out whether or not we have a Secretary of State."
